meta_description: In two locations -- Oak Bluffs, MA and Peterborough, NH -- the Mariposa Museum and World Culture Center fosters peace, equity, and human understanding through exhibits and programs that engage the senses, mind, and heart.

##  Museum Memberships 

##  Museum Memberships

[ Crescent Membership  $100.00  ](/memberships/p/f24o73rbtpzvf0oayzk0twxwlz2lhi)

Purchase  Added!

### Membership Details

  * ####  Basic Membership 

This membership tier offers unlimited visits for 1 adult and 1 child/grandchild plus a 10% discount in the gift shop. $65/year.

  * ####  Library Membership 

This membership tier includes unlimited visits for 1 adult and up to 2 children, with a library pass. $75/year.

  * ####  Family Membership 

This membership tier includes unlimited visits for two adults and their children/grandchildren, plus a 10% discount in the gift shop and a discount on rental for kids or family parties. $85/year.

  * ####  Crescent Membership 

This membership tier includes all the benefits of the Family tier, plus 2 free museum tickets to share, and membership in the North American Reciprocal Museum Association (NARM). NARM provides free or discounted admission to 900+ museums, botanical gardens, science, and technology centers throughout North America. $100/year.

#  Our website is under construction

#  Our website is under construction 〰️ Our website is under construction 〰️ 

The Mariposa Museum has two locations. One location is in Peterborough New Hampshire, and the other is in Oak Bluffs Massachusetts (on Martha’s Vineyard).

# The Mariposa Museums:

#### [Peterborough NH](/about-mariposa-peterborough-2)

**Closed until Feb 14, 2026 (except for specific events)**

[**Click here for hours, etc.**](/faq)

#### [Oak Bluffs, MA](/about-oak-bluffs-1)

**Closed until June 2026**

[**Click here for hours, etc.**](/faq)

The Mariposa is a museum of human understanding. Originally a museum of folk art, the Mariposa now also explores human experience and culture through a range of media and in a more contemporary context. Exhibits for all ages may examine a region of the world or cultures in transition, multiculturalism in the U.S., or an individual experience, all with an eye to understanding a diverse world and fostering greater compassion, understanding, and peace.

The Mariposa Museum in Oak Bluffs explores American history and African diaspora experience through the creativity of artists, storytellers, and scholars. The museum is open from June - October! We look forward to welcoming you!
